ratings.comment: GREAT professor who won't hold your hand or treat you like a high-schooler. Has no problems telling you exactly what you did wrong. Definitely go to class, lectures at a high level and will tell you so directly. Does a good job relating architecture to the culture of the time.

Menocal is one of the best professors I've had at UW. He is EXTREMELY knowledgeable and intelligent in his field, and pushes his students to explore architectural theories further. He is HILARIOUS and out of control. Class is entertaining. He wrote most of the readings in the reader. The only 2 exams were take home essays.

He is an arrogant professor who just reads facts to the class instead of teaching. The type of information we are supposed to learn is unclear especially when it comes exam time. The class is an ARCHITECTURAL art history course and we hardly ever learn about architecture! I would not recommend this class for anyone.

Narciso is a great person, but hard professor.   Be prepared to be called out in class on the spot.  Very difficult to get a hold of.  If you have a question or need to talk to him, get a hold of him after class.  He rarely responds to emails in a timely fashion.  GO TO CLASS!!!  If you don't go to the class, you will fail his courses.

If you're looking for a class in which you can just regurgitate facts on a test, Narciso's courses are not for you. This man will teach you the difference between actual learning and the crap other profs call teaching. This man is amazing.

Absoultely awful. Some may say he is 'brilliant' but I will put all of you on his absurb level of thinking as well. He is demeaning to his students, and has no problem making you feel inadequate when asking for clarification. Absolutely unprofessional, and I will be filing a complaint with the OED of Madison about his actions towards students.

Narciso can be tough and downright brutal at times but the man is a genius. I am taking his Frank Lloyd Wright course and feel like i really understand the mind of the great architect. It's more than memorizing building plans, this is a class ON Frank Lloyd Wright. Ask questions, don't be stupid, and he'll love you.

Narciso is the man... If you make some extra effort, he will reward it.  Question and  engage, but DO NOT fear, this man.  Although he seems harsh, embarrassing , and  confrontational to many, Narciso is ultimately attempting to challengw and bring out the best in his students.  If you try, you may learn a lot from this brilliant man.

As a person,narciso is fantastic. He is funny and interesting. However,if you want a good grade, do not take him. Over half the class failed the first midterm, and there are only the two tests as grades. He is EXTREMELY picky. I have not received anything below an A in any AH courses at UW, but I will be lucky to get a C in this one.

Narcisco is an adorable old man. That being said he should not be teaching anymore. The 1st/only art hist class I didn't do well in. He does not provide slides or a text-so images appear on the test that you had no access to and he just rambles on for the hour expecting you to catch every detail. this makes for HARD exam q's. only two tests.

This man is a truly AMAZING.  He can be a little hard to understand at times and is often lost for words, but trust me, it's worth taking a class with him if you're interested in art history at all.  Be nice to him and he'll become a grandpa-like figure.

Perhaps the only A.H. professor who was truly challenging and treated the subject as anything but an exercise in memorization.  He's incredibly passionate, interesting, engaging and approachable, and his classes are one of a kind.  I'll never look at Frank Lloyd Wright the same way again.  Be prepared to be called upon and put on the spot in class.
IM IN LOVE!!!!

Oh, Narciso! He's truly a favorite. At first he is terribly scary, but once he figures out that you're smart, he's an absolute peach. He's brilliant and hilarious. His lectures are fascinating if exhausting. There is almost no textbook use at all. Class is easy and fun, but you must like the subject or you will be in misery.

Best class I ever took; extremely helpful and knowledgeable, but as others have said, don't take the class if you can't write, can't think, or only think you might have a slight interest in the subject.
This man knows everything.  He can and will teach you anything you want if you ask.  Listen carefully and think.  Good grades will come.
HORRIBLE! AWFUL! Teaches his opinion, not facts! HORRIBLE tests that show nothing!  Scary!  Should have retired 10 years ago!

Narciso is incredibly patient, understanding, helpful, AND a genius.  It helps, however, if you have half a brain.  He likes that.  Definitely not a prof for the itinerant dabbler in arch. hist.  Go in with a passion, he'll pick up on it--and you'll have a PhD in no time.
Lots of fun!  This guy is hilarious!  His classes are incredibly easy too!

PLEASE don't take a class with this man!!! He's a terrible teacher and expects way beyond a level required for the class level & is scarry.  He hardly even got into the time period we were suppose to cover.
